Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Cryoablation for Early-Stage Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This phase II trial included patients

Participants.evidence: patients with unifocal invasive ductal breast cancer ≤2 cm, with <25% intraductal component and tumor enhancement on MRI

Intervention.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of cryoablation in treating early-stage breast cancer.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of cryoablation in treating early-stage breast cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the rate of complete tumor ablation

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 99 patients were enrolled from 19 centers

Number_Analysed.evidence: 86 patients (87 breast cancers) evaluable for data analysis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Successful ablation was achieved in 66/87 (75.9%) cancers, with a 90% confidence interval of 67.1–83.2.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the American College of Surgeons Oncology Group.
